boat.construction_details: Fibre glass hull marine ply decking
boat.full_description:
Agnes Jayne is a fine example of a Gaffers & Luggers Clovelly Picarooner, built by Martin Heard of Tregatreath Yacht Yard in Mylor, near Falmouth, Cornwall. The Picarooner is a sturdy and well-built seaworthy 16’ gaff rig sailing dayboat, based on the old wooden fishing boats that sailed out of Clovelly to fish for the local ‘silver darlings’ or herring. The original mould was taken from one of these old lug-rigged sailing boats, and the rig converted to the more popular gaff rig and steel centreplate, for this GRP version. 

She was brought from the West Country to Waldringfield on the River Deben and lives off the Maybush Pub. Her range is normally to one of the four other pubs on the River Deben for which there is convenient landing. I am grateful to the ECOGA who have inspired me and especially the husband of ECOGA Minutes Secretary who has helped maintain ‘Agnes Jayne’, mending broken gaff jaws, replacing a broken bowsprit and making a new tiller.
boat.name: Agnes Jayne
boat.short_description: ‘Agnes Jayne’ is a Gaffers & Luggers Clovelly Picarooner.
